title: [TFT] Top 500 Players from the Teamfight Tactics Beta on PBE
body:
Hey, tacticians!

The past several days have been a whirlwind for us as we’ve watched everyone playing Teamfight Tactics during the beta. Heading into live this week, we want to take a minute to have a good time and recognize some of the top tacticians by MMR.

A ton of you **also** braved long login queues over the weekend to play—needless to say, if many of you were able to play as much as you wanted to, this list might look **very** different.

Quick disclaimer: This is just a for fun thing. We’re not planning to give any rewards or publish MMR on an ongoing basis, but we might do more like this in the future if you enjoy it! Oh—and one more thing: MMR in TFT is different from other League modes (e.g., 2400 MMR in TFT isn’t the same as 2400 MMR on Summoner’s Rift).

Anyway, without further ado, our team humbly presents the top 500 Teamfight Tactics beta players. Enjoy the bragging rights, and we’ll see you in the arena!

replies.body: *Top 500 players who got through waiting for 10+ hours
Yep, we made sure to mention that in the post!

As someone without a PBE account and who is happy to wait until live release, it's probably a bit of a dick move to ask... But how about publishing a ranked list of the top 500 players who waited the longest in queue?

 {{sticker:sg-kiko}}

I win like 10 plus a day which is roughly 6 hours of gameplay just for those. I did miss day one and have had to wait a few hours in queue and a few hours on (losses). How did I not make it to this? Is that one day enough to knock me out of do they put in like 20 hours a day and abuse duplication hacks etc.?

To be fair on what you stated, i'm in the top 500 and missed 2 days + afking in lobby for hours (sorry login queue people). Many of people put in wins and Top 4 finishes. There were very very few games where I ended bottom 4. This was just for fun from riot and personally didnt know that there would be a MMR ranking/ was an MMR for this. I wouldn't worry until there is actual ranked system for this.
As if streamer had to wait more than 1 min lmao

would you rather all streamers wait 26hrs in q then while you were in q with all the other ppl, you couldn't even watch the game either cuz none online was streaming it? 

you comment is quite stupid it benefits both ppl in q and riot being able to promote the game and giving ppl a chance to watch the game.

(also not all streamers had priority q accs only some did)

i think more ppl got enjoyment from watching streamers play the game then the 20-30 ppl that would have gotten in over the 20-30streamers with prio q :)

Just imagine how amazing all of those queue streams would have been tho. RIP my dreams /s

{{sticker:cass-cry}}
the pepejam q streams XD rip

> [{quoted}](name=Spearki,realm=EUW,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=uU3LVE8R,comment-id=000000010000,timestamp=2019-06-25T16:54:10.823+0000)
>
> would you rather all streamers wait 26hrs in q then while you were in q with all the other ppl, you couldn't even watch the game either cuz none online was streaming it? 
> 
> you comment is quite stupid it benefits both ppl in q and riot being able to promote the game and giving ppl a chance to watch the game.
> 
> (also not all streamers had priority q accs only some did)
> 
> i think more ppl got enjoyment from watching streamers play the game then the 20-30 ppl that would have gotten in over the 20-30streamers with prio q :)

In Fairness, streamers would still get to stream it. In fact, the fact that everyone would have to wait for logging in would mean more exposure for lesser known streamers like myself. Yes that would mean less content from bignames, but there wouldn't be a shortage of content overall. 

It'd just be more variety since virtually anyone with a computer could get viewers since they have access to the content after they wait long enough.

> [{quoted}](name=FRiSKxARiA,realm=NA,application-id=A7LBtoKc,discussion-id=uU3LVE8R,comment-id=0000000100000001,timestamp=2019-06-28T14:05:40.738+0000)
